item.title: 沙特阿拉伯正以 1 万亿美元的高风险押注旅游业
item.description:
王国必须克服保守形象和对人权的担忧。

The kingdom must overcome a conservative image and concern about human rights. Visit the desert oasis town of AlUla to understand the challenge.

】

item.title: 国防公司正在吸引德国陷入困境的汽车工人
item.description: 德国的汽车制造商正处于危机之中。电气化和来自中国的竞争正将成千上万的高技能工人推回就业市场。幸运的是，许多人盯上了一个招聘速度不够快的行业：国防。【原文：Germany’s automakers are in crisis. Electrification and competition from China are booting thousands of highly skilled workers back onto the job market. Luckily, many are eyeing a sector that can’t hire fast enough: defense.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司董事会选择支付 50%的股息，结束争端
item.description: 巴西石油公司（Petroleo Brasileiro SA）董事会同意从 2023 年起支付其潜在特别股息的 50%，从而解决了因担心总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）对这家国家控制的石油生产商施加过多影响而引发的震撼巴西市场的争端。【原文：Petroleo Brasileiro SA’s board settled on a 50% payout of its potential extraordinary dividends from 2023, settling a dispute that rocked the Brazilian market over concerns that President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva was exercising too much influence over the state-controlled oil producer.】

item.title: 销售放缓，库存增加，特斯拉将美国售价下调 2000 美元
item.description: 周五晚些时候，特斯拉公司将其最畅销的 Model Y、Model X 和 Model S 在美国的售价下调了 2000 美元，此前令人失望的第一季度销量推高了库存。【原文：Tesla Inc. cut the price of its best selling Model Y, the Model X and the Model S by $2,000 in the US late Friday after disappointing first-quarter sales pushed up inventory.】

item.title: 穆勒称欧洲央行不应急于在 6 月后进一步降息
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马迪斯-穆勒（Madis Muller）表示，欧洲中央银行在 6 月份可能采取第一步降息措施后，绝不能急于进一步降息。【原文：The European Central Bank mustn’t rush into further interest rate cuts after a likely first step in June, Governing Council member Madis Muller said.】

item.title: 大众田纳西工厂成立工会，汽车工会取得里程碑式胜利
item.description: 田纳西州一家工厂的大众汽车公司员工投票决定加入美国汽车工人联合会（United Auto Workers）。【原文：Volkswagen AG employees at a Tennessee factory have voted to join the United Auto Workers, the labor group says, a landmark victory for union organizing in the long-hostile US South.】

item.title: 墨西哥总统阿姆鲁（AMLO）称比索暴跌 "有助于 "经济增长
item.description: 安德烈斯-曼努埃尔-洛佩斯-奥夫拉多尔总统说，墨西哥比索最近走软是一种帮助，因为该货币已变得过于坚挺。【原文：President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said the Mexican peso’s recent weakening was a help as the currency had become too strong.】

item.title: 墨西哥总统候选人认为墨西哥石油公司将对债务进行再融资
item.description: 墨西哥主要总统候选人克劳迪娅-希恩鲍姆（Claudia Sheinbaum）表示，她预计世界上负债最多的石油生产商墨西哥石油公司（Petroleos Mexicanos）将在 2025 年债券到期前进行再融资。【原文：Mexico’s leading presidential candidate Claudia Sheinbaum said she expects Petroleos Mexicanos, the world’s most indebted oil producer, to refinance its bonds ahead of upcoming maturities in 2025.】

item.title: 日本央行上田重申宽松政策将持续一段时间
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫重申，随着决策者继续购买政府债券，货币政策将在一段时间内保持宽松。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda reiterated monetary policy will stay accommodative for a while as policymakers continue to buy government bonds.】

item.title: 伊朗-以色列罢工周标志着中东 "游戏规则的改变
item.description: 周五，德黑兰宣布已击败以色列无人机对其领土发动的小规模袭击，伊朗和以色列之间长达数十年之久的暗战中最具煽动性的一周也随之结束。【原文：One of the most incendiary weeks in the decades-long shadow war between Iran and Israel ended with relief Friday after Tehran declared it had defeated what it said was a small attack on its territory by Israeli drones.】

item.title: 索尼收购派拉蒙的交易将受到更多监管审查
item.description: 据华盛顿的分析师称，包括日本索尼公司在内的派拉蒙全球公司的收购交易预计将引起美国监管机构的严格审查，因为美国监管机构负责审查外国买家的媒体收购交易，同时也会引起竞争管理机构的审查。【原文：A deal to buy Paramount Global that includes Japan’s Sony Group Corp. would be expected to draw scrutiny from US regulators who vet media purchases by foreign buyers, as well as a review from competition authorities, according to Washington-based analysts.】

item.title: 如果比索跌至 59，雷克托认为菲律宾存在推迟降息的风险
item.description: 菲律宾财政部长拉尔夫-雷克托（Ralph Recto）警告说，如果比索汇率跌破1美元兑59比索的历史低点，菲律宾可能会推迟降息，但这不会损害经济增长前景。【原文：Philippine Finance Secretary Ralph Recto cautioned that his nation may see a delay in interest-rate cuts should the peso weaken past the record low of 59 per dollar, though that wouldn’t damage the economic growth outlook.】

item.title: 参议员修改养老金法案后，哥伦比亚基金管理人觊觎 7.5 亿美元的费用红利
item.description: 哥伦比亚立法者在国会的养老金法案中增加了一项条款，允许基金经理额外收取 7.5 亿美元的管理费。【原文：Colombian lawmakers added a clause to a pension bill in congress that will allow fund managers to rake in an additional $750 million in management fees.】

item.title: 华尔街奖金规则三度重返监管议程
item.description: 美国金融监管机构计划再次对华尔街高管的薪酬进行监管；这是 2010 年《多德-弗兰克法案》的一项未决要求，但却屡次未能实现。【原文：US financial watchdogs plan to take another crack at regulating Wall Street executives’ pay — an outstanding requirement of the 2010 Dodd-Frank Act that has repeatedly failed to materialize.】

item.title: 中东风险令石油市场陷入不安的平静
item.description: 本周原油期货的交易价格从未高于上周五伊朗袭击以色列之前的水平。【原文：At no stage this week did crude futures trade higher than where they were last Friday, before Iran’s attack on Israel.】

item.title: 英国石油公司拒绝提高英国工人养老金的呼吁
item.description: 英国石油公司（BP Plc）拒绝将今年向英国退休工人支付的固定福利金额外提高 2%，称其养老金支付额在过去十年中已经超过了通货膨胀率。【原文：BP Plc declined to boost defined benefit payments to retired UK workers by an extra 2% this year, saying that its pension payouts have already been outpacing inflation over the past decade.】

item.title: 陷入困境的借款人在没有美联储减息的情况下仍在为跑道而战
item.description: 从表面上看，美国经济令人惊讶的韧性似乎对企业有利。但是，随着经济的扩张，压力正在表面之下形成，威胁着美国一些风险最大的公司。【原文：The surprising resilience of the US economy would seem, on the face of it, to be good for corporations. But as the expansion plows ahead, pressures are forming beneath the surface to threaten some of the country’s riskiest companies.】

item.title: 阿根廷拉里奥哈省因拖欠债券款在纽约被起诉
item.description: 阿根廷拉里奥哈省被债权人告上美国法院，从而使一场关于约 1,000 万美元债券拖欠款的法律战升级。【原文：The Argentine province of La Rioja was sued by creditors in US Court, escalating a legal battle over some $10 million in missed bond payments.】

item.title: 债权人和加纳希望在 5 月底前达成重组协议
item.description: 据直接知情人士透露，加纳和债权人预计最快将于 5 月底就重组海外债券达成原则性协议。【原文：Ghana and creditors expect to reach an agreement in principle to restructure overseas bonds as soon as the end of May, according to people with direct knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: S&P上调希腊评级，因债务下降而财政紧缩
item.description: S&P全球评级公司将希腊的主权信用展望从稳定上调至积极，就在几个月前，该公司将希腊重新置于投资级区域，而这一地位曾在2010年丧失。【原文：S&P Global Ratings raised Greece’s sovereign credit outlook to positive from stable, just months after the company put the country back in the investment grade zone, a status lost in 2010.】

item.title: 臃肿的华尔街牛市正在大规模套现离场
item.description: 随着华尔街一度所向披靡的牛市大军开始撤出赢利，2024 年的市场大反弹似乎岌岌可危。【原文：The great market rally of 2024 looks dangerously close to unraveling as Wall Street’s once-invincible bull brigade begins to withdraw its winnings.】

item.title: 首席执行官称净利息收入见底，第五季保险公司股价大涨
item.description: 首席执行官蒂姆-斯彭斯（Tim Spence）预测，贷款收入已经触底，第五季银行公司（Fifth Third Bancorp）的涨幅为四个月来最大，领涨银行股。【原文：Fifth Third Bancorp jumped the most in four months, leading bank stocks higher, with Chief Executive Officer Tim Spence predicting that income from lending has bottomed out.】

item.title: 科技股创 2022 年以来最大单周跌幅令市场动荡不安
item.description: 受中东紧张局势和对利率前景的担忧影响，美国股市周五大幅抛售，科技股创下17个月以来的最大单周跌幅。【原文：US equities sold off sharply on Friday, sending tech stocks to the biggest weekly loss in 17 months, due to tensions in the Middle East and worries over the outlook for interest rates.】

item.title: FTX 投资者与山姆-班克曼-弗里德达成和解，将起诉发起人
item.description: 一群 FTX 投资者和客户同意放弃对联合创始人山姆-班克曼-弗里德（Sam Bankman-Fried）的索赔，以换取他在加密货币交易所倒闭引发的一系列诉讼中对其他被告的合作。【原文：A group of FTX investors and customers has agreed to drop their claims against co-founder Sam Bankman-Fried in exchange for his cooperation against other defendants in a sprawling set of lawsuits over the cryptocurrency exchange’s collapse.】

item.title: 美联储推迟降息对美国和世界的意义
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会及其全球广大受众都认为 2024 年将是降息的大好时机。但事实证明，物价上涨比几乎所有人预测的都要顽固得多，这种预期正在迅速消退。美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔在4月16日证实了这一点，他表示，在一系列出人意料的高通胀数据公布后，政策制定者将等待比之前预期更长的时间才会降息。【原文：The US Federal Reserve and its vast global audience thought 2024 would be a rate-cut bonanza. But with price inflation proving much stickier than almost anyone predicted, those expectations are fading fast. Fed Chair Jerome Powell confirmed as much on April 16, when he signaled that policymakers would wait longer than previously anticipated to cut rates following a series of surprisingly high inflation readings.】

item.title: 马克莱姆认为加拿大预算案对财政影响不大
item.description: 加拿大央行行长蒂夫-马克莱姆（Tiff Macklem）表示，总理贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）最近的预算案并没有明显改变政府在 11 月份制定的财政路线。【原文：Bank of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem said Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s recent budget did not significantly change the fiscal track that the government laid out in November.】

item.title: 贝莱德计划首次将共同基金转换为ETF，这是时代的标志
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：BlackRock Inc. laid out plans for its first mutual fund-to-ETF conversion this week, joining a growing list of asset managers who have made the jump amid a one-way flood of cash between the structures.】

item.title: 欧洲央行利率制定者就 6 月降息达成一致，但其他问题不多
item.description: 有一点欧洲中央银行的官员们似乎达成了共识，即首次降息可能会在 6 月份进行。【原文：There’s one thing European Central Bank officials seem to agree on — that a first cut in interest rates will probably be delivered in June.】

item.title: 中国人民银行行长意外公布 GDP 后淡化人民币和通货紧缩风险
item.description: 中国央行行长潘功胜淡化了通货紧缩和人民币走软带来的风险，并强调中国经济在 2024 年的强劲开局使得 5%的官方增长目标指日可待。【原文：China’s central bank governor Pan Gongsheng downplayed risks from deflation and a weakening yuan and stressed that his econony’s strong start to 2024 put the official 5% growth target within reach.】

item.title: 嘉能可和特拉菲古拉的制裁游戏正在耗尽伦敦金属交易所的资金
item.description: 世界上最大的两家金属交易商正着手从伦敦金属交易所撤出大量铝，英国对俄罗斯金属的新制裁使这一复杂的交易成为可能，从而引发了对新规则意外后果的质疑。【原文：The world’s two biggest metals traders are moving to withdraw large volumes of aluminum from the London Metal Exchange in a complex trade made possible by new UK sanctions on Russian metal, raising questions about unintended consequences from the new rules.】
